alert.note: Alert for Hudson (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 08 at 3:33PM EDT until further notice by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM EDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...River and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of northeast New Jersey and southeast New York, including the following counties, in northeast New Jersey, Bergen and Hudson. In southeast New York, Rockland. * WHEN...Until 200 AM EDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding is till occurring along the Hackensack River, and may also still be possible on adjoining streams and nearby low lying and flood-prone locations. It will take a good portion of tonight for flood waters to recede on the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 333 PM EDT, Gauge reports indicated that moderate flooding is still occurring on the Hackensack River at River Vale. Moderate flooding there should continue into this evening, and lessen in severity overnight. Moderate flooding that had been occurring along the Hackensack River at New Milford is already lessening in severity, with minor flooding expected into tonight. - Some locations that could experience flooding include... Hackensack, Bergenfield, Secaucus, Ridgefield, Tappan, Pearl River, Oradell, Orangeburg, Teterboro, North Bergen, Teaneck, Palisades Park, Dumont, New Milford, Fairview, Ridgefield Park, River Edge, Little Ferry, River Vale and Valley Cottage. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
